pull_request.title: Add nix instructions for developers
pull_request.body:
The instructions for setting up using `nix` were not copied over when the nix setup was taken from https://github.com/pq-code-package/mlkem-c-embedded. I added them now. 

@hanno-becker does this contain all the information you were missing?

pull_request.title: Emulate arm64 binary on x86_64 machine
pull_request.body:
[//]: # (SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0)
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
I added `scripts/tests` (should be able to be executed by simply typing `tests` in nix shell) for functional, kat and nistkat tests.

The script currently automatically detects the host system and decides to run natively on ARM64 machines or emulate on QEMU for x86_64 machines. We might want to add the capability to manually specify whether to run tests natively or on QEMU in the future. However, I don't think we need this functionality for now.

Usage of the script is as follow:

```
> tests --help
Usage: tests [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:
  --help  Show this message and exit.

Commands:
  func     Run the functional tests for all parameter sets
  kat      Run the kat tests for all parameter sets
  nistkat  Run the nistkat tests for all parameter sets
  run      Run the specified binary file

> tests nistkat --help
Usage: tests nistkat [OPTIONS]

Options:
  -v, --verbose  Show verbose output or not
  --help         Show this message and exit.
```

I have also added `black` as the Python formatter and updated the `format` and `lint` scripts to utilize it for checking the format of Python scripts. I don't have a strong opinion on the choice of Python formatter, so if there are any better suggestions, I am open to using them.

I made CI continues even when some part of the tests failed as @hanno-becker suggested in https://github.com/pq-code-package/mlkem-c-aarch64/issues/48 (sorry about that I somehow missed the message last week).

- **emulate arm64 binary on x86_64 machine**
- **Output binaries to bin/ directory**
- **add nistkat checksum back**
- **use black for python formatting**
- **add tests script for running a specify binary**
- **factor out the common part of compiling and running a binary**
- **add test command for func, nistkat and kat tests**
- **compare tests result to the META file**
- **add github step summary to tests script if the env var exists**
- **update ci to use the tests script**
- **cleanup**
- **only add -static if is linux x86_64**
- **still run kat/nistkat tests even if previous tests failed**


<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review. -->

review.body:
I understand that we want developers to use `nix`, but I think a bare `make` should work out of the box on standard environments -- just to satisfy people who are curious about the repo and want to give it a very quick try.

Can we keep `make` working outside of the `nix` environment @potsrevennil ?

pull_request.title: Add Keccak X interface
pull_request.body:
### Prototype of Keccak Interface

This module is designed for reuse in Dilithium.

### Keccak X-Ways Behavior:

1. **Input Handling**: Uses scatter-gather memory style.
2. **Output Handling**: Also uses scatter-gather memory style.

The consecutive memory assumption complicates code reuse. Minor changes to the assembly implementation may be required. Specifically, for Keccak, we load individual vector registers, which necessitates a few additional vector permutation instructions.

### Keccak Design Steps:

1. User provides data for the input lane.
2. User provides output for each lane.
3. All lanes are absorbed simultaneously.
4. All lanes are squeezed simultaneously.

### Additional APIs for Single Lane Operations:

```c
uint64_t *keccakx_get_lane_state(keccakx *kx, size_t lane_index);
```

This allows for retrieving the state of a specific lane for continued single Keccak operations.

### Optimization Potential with Scatter-Gather Memory:

- **Multiple Pass Squeezing**: Currently, if `rej_uniform` fails to sample the full vector size, it continues by squeezing a single Keccak lane. By rewriting this logic to append single Keccak calls into a single Keccak X-way call, CPU cycles can be saved. For simplicity, it is currently implemented as a single pass.

### Implementation Details:

Originally, the implementation of KeccakX used heap memory, but it has been converted to stack-only, which is more efficient.

### Next Steps:

- Add Keccak_X_Way assembly to replace the `for loop` in `fips202x.c`.

Fixes #35

pull_request.title: Add Keccak X4 interface
pull_request.body:
# Add Keccak X4 interface. 

Potential optimization: 

- **Multiple Pass Squeezing**: Currently, if `rej_uniform` fails to sample the full vector size, it continues by squeezing a single Keccak lane. By rewriting this logic to append single Keccak calls into a single Keccak X-way call, CPU cycles can be saved. For simplicity, it is currently implemented as a single pass.

### Next Steps:

- Add Keccak_X4 assembly to replace the `keccak_absorb_x4keccak_squeezeblocks_x4` in `fips202x.c`.

Fixes #35

[//]: # (SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0)
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
I added `scripts/tests` (should be able to be executed by simply typing `tests` in nix shell) for functional, kat and nistkat tests.

The script currently automatically detects the host system and decides to run natively on ARM64 machines or emulate on QEMU for x86_64 machines. We might want to add the capability to manually specify whether to run tests natively or on QEMU in the future. However, I don't think we need this functionality for now.

```

Usage: tests [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:
  --help  Show this message and exit.

Commands:
  func     Run the functional tests for all parameter sets
  kat      Run the kat tests for all parameter sets

> tests nistkat --help
Usage: tests nistkat [OPTIONS]

Options:
```

I made CI continues even when some part of the tests failed as @hanno-becker suggested in https://github.com/pq-code-package/mlkem-c-aarch64/issues/48 (sorry about that I somehow missed the message last week).

- **emulate arm64 binary on x86_64 machine**
